metadata.name: I Dream Of Demons The Beginning
metadata.description:
In the conscious world, Eliot was a man of simple means. An artist by trade, he had always found comfort in the calm, the predictable. His brushes painted landscapes of familiar vistas and tranquil scenes, his hand finding delight in the simple pleasures of replicating reality on canvas. But every night, Eliot descended into a pandemonium unseen by the waking eye, a terrifying netherworld where the sky bled crimson, and the world morphed with the capriciousness of a fevered brain.

Each dream was like a nightmarish adventure through this diabolical landscape. It twisted and turned, its evershifting nature reflecting the uncertainty and fear that gnawed at the edges of his consciousness. The hills slithered like serpents, forests grew, fell, and twisted into abhorrent shapes within a heartbeat. Rivers of inky darkness flowed upwards into a storm-ridden sky, which blinked with thousands of eyes that stared down at him, full of malice.
